documents.title: Pydantic AI
documents.description: GenAI Agent Framework, the Pydantic way
documents.summary: Pydantic AI is a Python framework for building production-grade Generative AI agents and workflows using Pydantic for validation and type safety. It provides a model-agnostic environment with built-in observability, durable execution, and support for complex agentic patterns.

documents.title: Agent2Agent (A2A) - Pydantic AI
documents.description: GenAI Agent Framework, the Pydantic way
documents.summary: This document introduces the Agent2Agent (A2A) Protocol and the FastA2A library, explaining how to implement interoperable AI agent communication in Python and expose Pydantic AI agents as A2A-compliant servers.

documents.title: Built-in Tools - Pydantic AI
documents.description: GenAI Agent Framework, the Pydantic way
documents.summary: This document explains how to use native built-in tools provided by LLM providers within Pydantic AI, including details on tool types, provider support, and dynamic configuration.

documents.title: Agents - Pydantic AI
documents.description: GenAI Agent Framework, the Pydantic way
documents.summary: This document introduces the Agent class as the primary interface for Pydantic AI, detailing its core components such as instructions, tools, and dependency types. It explains the conceptual framework of agents and outlines the various synchronous and asynchronous methods for executing them.

documents.title: Upgrade Guide - Pydantic AI
documents.description: GenAI Agent Framework, the Pydantic way
documents.summary: This document outlines the breaking changes and migration requirements for Pydantic AI across various versions to help developers upgrade their applications to V1 and beyond.

documents.title: Common Tools - Pydantic AI
documents.description: GenAI Agent Framework, the Pydantic way
documents.summary: This document explains how to install and integrate native web search tools, such as DuckDuckGo and Tavily, into Pydantic AI agents to enable real-time information retrieval.

documents.title: Clai - Pydantic AI
documents.description: GenAI Agent Framework, the Pydantic way
documents.summary: This document explains how to install and use the Pydantic AI CLI (clai) to interact with AI agents via terminal or a web-based chat interface. It covers configuration, command-line options, and programmatic integration with custom agents.

documents.title: Contributing - Pydantic AI
documents.description: GenAI Agent Framework, the Pydantic way
documents.summary: This document provides instructions and guidelines for contributing to the Pydantic AI project, including environment setup, testing procedures, and specific criteria for submitting new models.

documents.title: Dependencies - Pydantic AI
documents.description: GenAI Agent Framework, the Pydantic way
documents.summary: This document explains how to use Pydantic AI's dependency injection system to pass type-safe data and services to agents, tools, and prompts. It covers defining dependencies with dataclasses and accessing them through the RunContext object during execution.

documents.title: Deferred Tools - Pydantic AI
documents.description: GenAI Agent Framework, the Pydantic way
documents.summary: This document explains how to implement deferred tools in Pydantic AI for scenarios requiring human approval or external execution before completing a tool call. It details the workflow of using DeferredToolRequests and DeferredToolResults to persist agent state across multiple runs.

documents.title: Embeddings - Pydantic AI
documents.description: GenAI Agent Framework, the Pydantic way
documents.summary: This document explains how to use the Pydantic AI embedding interface to generate vector representations of text, manage different providers, and handle embedding results for tasks like semantic search and RAG.

documents.title: Direct Model Requests - Pydantic AI
documents.description: GenAI Agent Framework, the Pydantic way
documents.summary: The direct module provides low-level, imperative functions for making synchronous and asynchronous requests to LLMs with minimal abstraction. It is designed for scenarios requiring granular control over model interactions and custom implementations outside of the higher-level Agent API.

documents.title: Pydantic Evals - Pydantic AI
documents.description: GenAI Agent Framework, the Pydantic way
documents.summary: Pydantic Evals is a code-first framework for systematically evaluating AI systems through datasets, experiments, and various scoring evaluators. It enables developers to test LLM outputs and agent behaviors using a structured Python-based data model.

documents.title: Pydantic AI Gateway - Pydantic AI
documents.description: GenAI Agent Framework, the Pydantic way
documents.summary: This document introduces the Pydantic AI Gateway, a unified interface for managing multiple LLM providers with features like centralized API key management, cost tracking, and observability. It provides instructions for account setup, provider configuration, and integration with various AI SDKs.

documents.title: Overview - Pydantic AI
documents.description: GenAI Agent Framework, the Pydantic way
documents.summary: This document introduces pydantic-graph, a type-safe library for building asynchronous graphs and finite state machines to model and control complex workflows in Python.

documents.title: Image, Audio, Video & Document Input - Pydantic AI
documents.description: GenAI Agent Framework, the Pydantic way
documents.summary: This document explains how to provide multimodal inputs such as images, audio, video, and documents to LLMs using Pydantic AI. It details how to handle both URL-based and local binary content across different model providers.

documents.title: Getting Help - Pydantic AI
documents.description: GenAI Agent Framework, the Pydantic way
documents.summary: This document outlines the available support channels and community resources for users seeking help with Pydantic AI, specifically highlighting Slack and GitHub Issues.

documents.title: Installation - Pydantic AI
documents.description: GenAI Agent Framework, the Pydantic way
documents.summary: This document provides comprehensive instructions for installing the Pydantic AI library, detailing full, slim, and model-specific installation methods using pip and uv.

documents.title: Multi-Agent Patterns - Pydantic AI
documents.description: GenAI Agent Framework, the Pydantic way
documents.summary: Explains how to coordinate multiple agents in Pydantic AI applications, with a detailed focus on agent delegation through tool calls and managing shared dependencies.

documents.title: Debugging & Monitoring with Pydantic Logfire - Pydantic AI
documents.description: GenAI Agent Framework, the Pydantic way
documents.summary: This document explains how to integrate and use Pydantic Logfire with Pydantic AI to provide observability, tracing, and performance monitoring for LLM applications.

documents.title: Messages and chat history - Pydantic AI
documents.description: GenAI Agent Framework, the Pydantic way
documents.summary: This document explains how to access and retrieve message history from Pydantic AI agent runs using RunResult and StreamedRunResult objects. It describes methods for extracting complete conversation logs or run-specific messages in both object and JSON formats.

documents.title: Testing - Pydantic AI
documents.description: GenAI Agent Framework, the Pydantic way
documents.summary: This document explains strategies and tools for unit testing Pydantic AI applications, focusing on the use of TestModel and FunctionModel to mock LLM responses. It demonstrates how to override agent configurations and block accidental real-world model requests to ensure efficient and reliable testing.

documents.title: Output - Pydantic AI
documents.description: GenAI Agent Framework, the Pydantic way
documents.summary: This document explains how to define and handle agent outputs, including structured data validation using Pydantic models and type-safe result wrappers.

documents.title: HTTP Request Retries - Pydantic AI
documents.description: GenAI Agent Framework, the Pydantic way
documents.summary: This document explains how to implement and configure retry functionality in Pydantic AI using custom HTTP transports and the tenacity library. It details strategies for handling transient network failures, rate limits, and server errors through asynchronous and synchronous transport classes.

documents.title: Third-Party Tools - Pydantic AI
documents.description: GenAI Agent Framework, the Pydantic way
documents.summary: This document explains how to integrate third-party tool ecosystems like LangChain and ACI.dev into Pydantic AI agents using dedicated adapters and toolsets.

documents.title: Thinking - Pydantic AI
documents.description: GenAI Agent Framework, the Pydantic way
documents.summary: This document explains how to enable and configure reasoning or 'thinking' capabilities for various LLM providers within the Pydantic AI framework.

documents.title: Function Tools - Pydantic AI
documents.description: GenAI Agent Framework, the Pydantic way
documents.summary: This document explains how to use function tools in Pydantic AI to enable models to perform actions and retrieve information through decorators and toolsets. It details various registration methods and distinguishes function tools from related concepts like RAG and structured outputs.

documents.title: Advanced Tool Features - Pydantic AI
documents.description: GenAI Agent Framework, the Pydantic way
documents.summary: This document explains advanced tool functionalities in Pydantic AI, focusing on multi-modal return types, the ToolReturn class for complex context management, and dynamic tool schema generation.

documents.title: Toolsets - Pydantic AI
documents.description: GenAI Agent Framework, the Pydantic way
documents.summary: This document explains how to use toolsets in Pydantic AI to organize, reuse, and dynamically manage collections of tools for AI agents.

documents.title: Version policy - Pydantic AI
documents.description: GenAI Agent Framework, the Pydantic way
documents.summary: This document outlines the versioning policy for Pydantic AI, detailing rules for breaking changes, beta feature stability, and the lifecycle for supporting Python versions.

documents.title: Troubleshooting - Pydantic AI
documents.description: GenAI Agent Framework, the Pydantic way
documents.summary: Provides solutions for common errors in Pydantic AI, covering issues with Jupyter event loops, API key configuration, and HTTPX request monitoring.

documents.description: GenAI Agent Framework, the Pydantic way

documents.title: Built-in Evaluators - Pydantic AI
documents.description: GenAI Agent Framework, the Pydantic way
documents.summary: This document details the built-in evaluators provided by Pydantic Evals for verifying model outputs through comparisons, type checks, performance metrics, and LLM-based judgments.

documents.title: Quick Start - Pydantic AI
documents.description: GenAI Agent Framework, the Pydantic way
documents.summary: Pydantic Evals is a framework for systematically testing and evaluating AI systems using structured datasets, evaluators, and automated reporting. It supports deterministic checks, LLM-based judging, and performance monitoring to track changes and ensure system reliability.

documents.title: LLM Judge - Pydantic AI
documents.description: GenAI Agent Framework, the Pydantic way
documents.summary: This document provides a detailed overview of the LLMJudge evaluator in pydantic-evals, explaining how to use LLMs to assess subjective output qualities through rubrics, scoring, and context integration.

documents.title: Overview - Pydantic AI
documents.description: GenAI Agent Framework, the Pydantic way
documents.summary: This document explains the core components of Pydantic Evals known as evaluators, which are used to analyze and score task outputs through deterministic checks, LLM-based judgment, or custom logic. It details the different result types, such as assertions and scores, and provides guidance on combining multiple evaluation strategies.

documents.title: Span-Based - Pydantic AI

documents.summary: This document explains how to evaluate AI system behavior by analyzing internal execution paths using OpenTelemetry spans captured via Logfire. It provides guidance on using evaluators to verify tool usage, performance metrics, and complex agent logic.

documents.summary: This document provides a practical example of using the pydantic-evals library to perform deterministic validation and performance benchmarking on a Python function.

documents.description: GenAI Agent Framework, the Pydantic way
documents.summary: This document explains how to control parallel execution of evaluation cases using the max_concurrency parameter to manage rate limits, resource constraints, and debugging.

documents.title: Dataset Management - Pydantic AI
documents.description: GenAI Agent Framework, the Pydantic way
documents.summary: This document explains how to manage evaluation datasets using pydantic-evals, covering manual creation, serialization to YAML and JSON, loading from various formats, and automated generation via LLMs.

documents.title: Dataset Serialization - Pydantic AI
documents.description: GenAI Agent Framework, the Pydantic way
documents.summary: This document explains how to serialize and deserialize datasets using YAML and JSON formats, including automatic JSON schema generation for IDE support and handling custom evaluators.

documents.title: Metrics & Attributes - Pydantic AI
documents.description: GenAI Agent Framework, the Pydantic way
documents.summary: Explains how to record and use custom numeric metrics and qualitative attributes during task execution to enhance evaluation insights and reporting.

documents.title: Retry Strategies - Pydantic AI
documents.description: GenAI Agent Framework, the Pydantic way
documents.summary: This document explains how to implement automatic retry logic for tasks and evaluators using the Tenacity library to handle transient failures like rate limits and network timeouts.

documents.title: Logfire Integration - Pydantic AI
documents.description: GenAI Agent Framework, the Pydantic way
documents.summary: This guide explains how to integrate Pydantic Evals with Pydantic Logfire to visualize, analyze, and debug evaluation results using OpenTelemetry traces. It covers installation, configuration, and best practices for monitoring evaluation performance.

documents.title: Agent User Interaction (AG-UI) - Pydantic AI
documents.description: GenAI Agent Framework, the Pydantic way
documents.summary: This document provides a setup guide and code examples for integrating Pydantic AI agents with the AG-UI Dojo frontend to demonstrate agentic chat and generative UI features.

documents.title: Bank support - Pydantic AI
documents.description: GenAI Agent Framework, the Pydantic way
documents.summary: A comprehensive example demonstrating how to build a bank support agent using Pydantic AI, covering dynamic system prompts, structured outputs, and tool integration.

documents.title: Chat App with FastAPI - Pydantic AI
documents.description: GenAI Agent Framework, the Pydantic way
documents.summary: This document demonstrates how to build a real-time chat application using FastAPI and Pydantic AI, featuring streaming responses and persistent conversation history stored in SQLite.

documents.title: Flight booking - Pydantic AI
documents.description: GenAI Agent Framework, the Pydantic way
documents.summary: This document demonstrates a multi-agent orchestration flow where specialized agents delegate tasks to each other, perform structured data extraction, and use procedural validation.

documents.title: Pydantic Model - Pydantic AI
documents.description: GenAI Agent Framework, the Pydantic way
documents.summary: This document demonstrates how to use Pydantic AI to extract structured data from text input and map it directly to a Pydantic model using the Agent's output_type parameter.

documents.title: Data Analyst - Pydantic AI
documents.description: GenAI Agent Framework, the Pydantic way
documents.summary: This document demonstrates how to use agent dependencies in Pydantic AI to share state and tool outputs across a workflow. It specifically illustrates a data analysis use case where large DataFrames are handled via references rather than passing raw row data to the LLM.

documents.title: Question Graph - Pydantic AI
documents.description: GenAI Agent Framework, the Pydantic way
documents.summary: This document demonstrates how to build an interactive AI-driven question and evaluation system using pydantic-graph and pydantic-ai. It showcases multi-node state management, agent orchestration, and file-based state persistence in a graph-based workflow.

documents.title: Setup - Pydantic AI
documents.description: GenAI Agent Framework, the Pydantic way
documents.summary: This document provides instructions for installing dependencies, configuring environment variables, and running the provided example code for the Pydantic AI library.

documents.title: RAG - Pydantic AI
documents.description: GenAI Agent Framework, the Pydantic way
documents.summary: This document provides a comprehensive example of implementing Retrieval-Augmented Generation (RAG) using PydanticAI and pgvector to build a document-aware chat agent.

documents.title: Stream markdown - Pydantic AI
documents.description: GenAI Agent Framework, the Pydantic way
documents.summary: This document demonstrates how to stream markdown text responses from a Pydantic AI agent and render them in real-time within a terminal using the rich library.

documents.title: SQL Generation - Pydantic AI
documents.description: GenAI Agent Framework, the Pydantic way
documents.summary: This document demonstrates how to build a Pydantic AI agent that generates and validates PostgreSQL SQL queries based on natural language input using dynamic prompts and structured output.

documents.title: Slack Lead Qualifier with Modal - Pydantic AI
documents.description: GenAI Agent Framework, the Pydantic way
documents.summary: This document provides a step-by-step tutorial on building and deploying an AI-powered Slack lead qualifier agent using Pydantic AI, Modal, and Logfire. It explains how to automate user research, send real-time analysis to Slack channels, and manage infrastructure through serverless Python functions.

documents.title: Stream whales - Pydantic AI
documents.description: GenAI Agent Framework, the Pydantic way
documents.summary: This document demonstrates how to implement and validate streaming structured outputs from an LLM using Pydantic AI and Python's asynchronous capabilities.

documents.title: Weather agent - Pydantic AI
documents.description: GenAI Agent Framework, the Pydantic way
documents.summary: This document provides a practical implementation guide for creating AI agents capable of sequential tool usage and dependency management using the Pydantic AI framework. It explains how to integrate external APIs, handle asynchronous requests, and monitor agent performance.

documents.title: Getting Started - Pydantic AI
documents.description: GenAI Agent Framework, the Pydantic way
documents.summary: This document introduces the beta graph API in pydantic-graph, explaining how to use the builder pattern to construct complex workflows featuring parallel execution, conditional branching, and data aggregation.

documents.title: Joins & Reducers - Pydantic AI
documents.description: GenAI Agent Framework, the Pydantic way
documents.summary: This document explains how join nodes in Pydantic Graph synchronize and aggregate results from parallel execution paths using reducer functions. It covers the creation of join nodes and the application of built-in reducers for common data operations.

documents.title: Decisions - Pydantic AI
documents.description: GenAI Agent Framework, the Pydantic way
documents.summary: This document explains how to implement conditional branching in graphs using decision nodes, covering type matching, union types, and custom matchers.

documents.title: Parallel Execution - Pydantic AI
documents.description: GenAI Agent Framework, the Pydantic way
documents.summary: This document explains how to implement parallel execution in the Pydantic Graph beta API using broadcasting and mapping techniques. It details how to fan out data to multiple steps or iterate over collections for concurrent processing.

documents.title: Steps - Pydantic AI
documents.description: GenAI Agent Framework, the Pydantic way
documents.summary: This document explains how to define and use steps as the fundamental units of work in a graph, covering step creation, state management, dependency injection, and customization.
